description: Connect to the Box Cloud Storage API to manage, share, and upload files to the cloud. Test an API call in your browser and export the code snippet into your app.

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Returns access tokens. An access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session. In the normal order of operations you will begin by requesting authentication from the Box authorize endpoint and Box will send you an authorization code. You will then send the authorization code to the token endpoint in a request for an access token. You can then use the returned access token to make Box API calls.

args.name: code
args.info: The authorization code returned by Box in response to a successfull authentication request.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The client ID of the application requesting authentication. To get the client ID for your application, log in to your Box developer console and click the Edit Application link for the application you're working with. In the OAuth 2 Parameters section of the configuration page, find the item labeled
args.client_id: The text of that item is your application's client ID.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: The client secret of the application requesting authentication. To get the client secret for your application, log in to your Box developer console and click the Edit Application link for the application you're working with. In the OAuth 2 Parameters section of the configuration page, find the item labeled
args.client_secret: The text of that item is your application's client secret.

blocks.name: revokeAccessToken
blocks.description: Revoke endpoint, the endpoint that revokes access tokens, or to put it another way, the endpoint that ends sessions, logging users out.

args.name: token
args.info: An access token or refresh token supplied by Box in response to a token request. When either token is supplied with this request, both will be revoked.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The client ID of the application requesting authentication. To get the client ID for your application, log in to your Box developer console and click the Edit Application link for the application you're working with. In the OAuth 2 Parameters section of the configuration page, find the item labeled
args.client_id: The text of that item is your application's client ID.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: The client secret of the application requesting authentication. To get the client secret for your application, log in to your Box developer console and click the Edit Application link for the application you're working with. In the OAuth 2 Parameters section of the configuration page, find the item labeled
args.client_secret: The text of that item is your application's client secret.

blocks.name: getFileInfo
blocks.description: Get information about a file.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: fileId
args.info: File Id

args.name: fields
args.info: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

blocks.name: downloadFile
blocks.description: Retrieves the actual data of the file. An optional version parameter can be set to download a previous version of the file.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: fileId
args.info: File Id

args.name: version
args.info: Optional file version ID to download (defaults to the current version)

args.name: range
args.info: The range value in bytes. Format should be bytes={start_range}-{end_range}

args.name: boxApi
args.info: Use the format shared_link=SHARED_LINK_URL or shared_link=SHARED_LINK_URL&shared_link_password=PASSWORD

blocks.name: uploadFile
blocks.description: Use the Upload API to allow users to add a new file. The user can then upload a file by specifying the destination folder for the file. If the user provides a file name that already exists in the destination folder, the user will receive an error.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: file
args.info: Uploaded file

args.name: parentId
args.info: The ID of the parent folder. Use '0' for the root folder.

blocks.name: uploadFileVersion
blocks.description: Uploading a new file version is performed in the same way as uploading a file. This method is used to upload a new version of an existing file in a user’s account. Similar to regular file uploads, these are performed as multipart form uploads.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: fileId
args.info: File Id

args.name: file
args.info: Uploaded file

args.name: name
args.info: New file name

blocks.name: verifyFileAcceptance
blocks.description: Verify that a file will be accepted by Box before you send all the bytes over the wire.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: name
args.info: File Id

args.name: parentId
args.info: The ID of the parent folder. Use '0' for the root folder.

args.name: size
args.info: The size of the file in bytes

blocks.name: updateFileInfo
blocks.description: Update the information about a file, including renaming or moving the file.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: fileId
args.info: File Id

args.name: name
args.info: The new name for the file

args.name: description
args.info: The new description for the file

args.name: parentId
args.info: The ID of the parent folder. Use '0' for the root folder.

args.name: sharedLinkAccess
args.info: The level of access. Can be open ('People with the link'), company ('People in your company'), or collaborators ('People in this folder'). If you omit this field then the access level will be set to the default access level specified by the enterprise admin.

args.name: sharedLinkPassword
args.info: The password required to access the shared link. Set to null to remove the password.

args.name: sharedLinkUnsharedAt
args.info: The date-time that this link will become disabled. This field can only be set by users with paid accounts.

args.name: sharedLinkPermissionsCanDownload
args.info: Whether the shared link allows downloads. Can only be set with access levels open and company (not collaborators).

args.name: tags
args.info: All tags attached to this file. To add/remove a tag to/from a file, you can first get the file’s current tags (be sure to specify ?fields=tags, since the tags field is not returned by default); then modify the list as required; and finally, set the file’s entire list of tags.

blocks.name: deleteFile
blocks.description: Move a file to the trash.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: fileId
args.info: File Id

args.name: fileId

args.info: The ID of the destination folder

args.name: name
args.info: An optional new name for the file

args.info: Whether or not the file can be downloaded while locked

args.name: accessToken

args.info: The maximum number of items to return

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of items to return. The default is 1,000 and the maximum is 1,000.

blocks.name: getFileVersions
blocks.description: Get information on prior versions of a file.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: fileId
args.info: File Id

args.name: fields
args.info: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

args.name: offset
args.info: The offset of the item at which to begin the response. See offset-based paging for details.

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of items to return

blocks.name: promoteFileVersion
blocks.description: Copy a previous file version and make it the current version of the file. This create a copy of the old file version and puts it on the top of the versions stack. The file will have the exact same contents, the same SHA-1/etag, and the same name as the original. Other properties such as comments do not get updated to their former values.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: fileId
args.info: File Id

args.name: fields
args.info: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

blocks.name: deleteOldFileVersion
blocks.description: Discards a file version to the trash.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: fileId
args.info: File Id

args.name: id
args.info: The ID of the file version.

args.info: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

blocks.description: Gets all of the files, folders, or web links contained within this folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: folderId
args.info: Folder Id

args.name: fields
args.info: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

args.name: offset
args.info: The offset of the item at which to begin the response. See offset-based paging for details.

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of items to return. The default is 100 and the maximum is 1,000.

blocks.name: createFolder
blocks.description: Create a new folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: fields
args.info: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

args.name: name
args.info: The desired name for the folder

args.name: parentId
args.info: The ID of the parent folder

blocks.name: updateFolder
blocks.description: Update a folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: folderId
args.info: Folder Id

args.name: fields
args.info: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

args.name: name
args.info: The desired name for the folder

args.name: description
args.info: The description of the folder

args.name: parentId
args.info: The ID of the parent folder

args.name: sharedLinkAccess
args.info: The level of access. Can be open ('People with the link'), company ('People in your company'), or collaborators ('People in this folder'). If you omit this field then the access level will be set to the default access level specified by the enterprise admin.

args.name: sharedLinkPassword
args.info: The password required to access the shared link. Set to null to remove the password.

args.name: sharedLinkUnsharedAt
args.info: The date-time that this link will become disabled. This field can only be set by users with paid accounts.

args.name: sharedLinkPermissionsCanDownload
args.info: Whether the shared link allows downloads. For shared links on folders, this also applies to any items in the folder. Can only be set with access levels open and company (not collaborators)

args.name: ownedById
args.info: The ID of the user (should be your own user ID)

args.name: syncState
args.info: Whether Box Sync clients will sync this folder. Values of synced or not_synced can be sent, while partially_synced may also be returned.

args.name: tags
args.info: All tags attached to this folder. To add/remove a tag to/from a folder, you can first get the folder’s current tags (be sure to specify ?fields=tags, since the tags field is not returned by default); then modify the list as required; and finally, set the folder’s entire list of tags.

blocks.name: deleteFolder
blocks.description: Move a folder to the trash. The recursive parameter must be included in order to delete folders that aren't empty.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: folderId
args.info: Folder id

args.name: recursive
args.info: Whether to delete this folder if it has items inside of it.

blocks.name: copyFolder
blocks.description: Used to create a copy of a folder in another folder. The original version of the folder will not be altered.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: folderId
args.info: Folder id

args.name: parentId
args.info: The ID of the destination folder

args.name: fields
args.info: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

args.name: name
args.info: An optional new name for the folder

args.info: The ID of the file or folder

args.name: endpoint
args.info: files or folders

args.name: sharedLinkAccess
args.info: The level of access. Can be open ('People with the link'), company ('People in your company'), or collaborators ('People in this folder'). If you omit this field then the access level will be set to the default access level specified by the enterprise admin.

args.name: sharedLinkPassword
args.info: The password required to access the shared link. Set to null to remove the password.

args.name: sharedLinkUnsharedAt
args.info: The date-time that this link will become disabled. This field can only be set by users with paid accounts.

args.name: sharedLinkPermissionsCanDownload
args.info: Can be open or collaborators

args.info: The ID of the file or folder

args.name: sharedLinkAccess
args.info: The level of access. Can be open ('People with the link'), company ('People in your company'), or collaborators ('People in this folder'). If you omit this field then the access level will be set to the default access level specified by the enterprise admin.

args.name: sharedLinkPassword
args.info: The password required to access the shared link. Set to null to remove the password.

args.name: sharedLinkUnsharedAt
args.info: The date-time that this link will become disabled. This field can only be set by users with paid accounts.

args.name: sharedLinkPermissionsCanDownload
args.info: Can be open or collaborators

blocks.name: getSharedItem
blocks.description: Use this API to obtain the ID of a file or folder from a shared link URL. Pass the URL (and password, if needed) in the BoxApi header. Once you have the ID of the file or folder, you can call any API to access that file or folder a long as you also pass the BoxApi header to those APIs. The header must be passed in each API call since your account would not otherwise have permission to access the shared item. Passing the shared link URL validates that the item was shared with you (e.g. via email or any other channel).

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: sharedLinkUrl
args.info: Url of shared link

args.name: sharedLinkPassword
args.info: Password of shared link

blocks.name: getTrashedItems
blocks.description: Gets the files, folders and web links that are in the user's trash.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: fields
args.info: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

args.name: offset
args.info: The offset of the item at which to begin the response. See offset-based paging for details.

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of items to return. The default is 100 and the maximum is 1,000.

blocks.name: getSingleTrashedItem
blocks.description: Get an item that has been moved to the trash.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: id
args.info: The ID of the file, folder or web link

args.name: endpoint
args.info: files, folders or web_links

args.name: fields
args.info: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

blocks.name: restoreTrashedItem
blocks.description: Restores an item that has been moved to the trash.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: id
args.info: The ID of the file, folder or web link

args.name: endpoint
args.info: files, folders or web_links

args.name: fields
args.info: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

args.name: parentId
args.info: The ID of the new parent folder. Only used if the previous parent folder no longer exists or the user doesn't have permission to restore the item there.

args.name: name
args.info: The new name for this item. Only used if the item can't be restored with its previous name due to a conflict.

blocks.name: permanentlyDeleteItem
blocks.description: Permanently delete an item that is in the trash. The item will no longer exist in Box. This action cannot be undone.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: id
args.info: The ID of the file, folder or web link

args.name: endpoint
args.info: files, folders or web_links

blocks.name: searchContent
blocks.description: The search endpoint provides a powerful way to find Box content. Use the parameters described in this section to control what you search for.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: query
args.info: The string to search for. Box matches the search string against object names, descriptions, text contents of files, and other data.

args.name: scope
args.info: The scope on which you want search. Can be user_content for a search limited to the current user or enterprise_content to search an entire enterprise.

args.name: fileExtensions
args.info: Limit searches to specific file extensions like pdf,png, or doc. The value can be a single file extension or a comma-delimited list of extensions. For example: png,md,pdf

args.name: createdAtRange
args.info: The date when the item was created. Specify the date range using RFC3339 timestamps separated by a comma. For example: `2014-05-15T13:35:01-07:00,2014-05-17T13:35:01-07:00. Either the beginning date or the ending date may be empty, but the separating comma is required. For example, if you omit the beginning date, then the ending date must begin with a comma.

args.name: updatedAtRange
args.info: The date when the item was updated. Specify the date range using RFC3339 timestamps separated by a comma. For example: `2014-05-15T13:35:01-07:00,2014-05-17T13:35:01-07:00. Either the beginning date or the ending date may be empty, but the separating comma is required. For example, if you omit the beginning date, then the ending date must begin with a comma.

args.name: sizeRange
args.info: Return only files within a stated size range. Specify the range in bytes with lower and upper bounds separated by a comma, like so:lower_bound_size,upper_bound_size, where 1MB is 1,000,000 bytes. You can specify only the lower bound if you end this parameter with a comma. You can specify only the upper bound by placing a comma at the beginning of the number.

args.name: ownerUserIds
args.info: Search for objects by owner. Requires a user ID or a set of comma-delimited user IDs, like so: user_id_1,user_id_2

args.name: ancestorFolderIds
args.info: Search for the contents of specific folders (and folders within them). Requires a folder ID or a set of comma-delimited folder IDs, like so: folder_id_1,folder_id_2

args.name: contentTypes
args.info: Search for objects of specified content types. The types can be name, description, file_content, comments, or tags. Requires a content type or a set of comma-delimited content_types, like so: content_type_1,content_type_2

args.name: type
args.info: The type of objects you want to include in the search results. The type can be file, folder, or web_link

args.name: trashContent
args.info: Controls whether to search in the trash. The value can be trashed_only or non_trashed_only. Searches without this parameter default to searching non_trashed_only

args.name: fields
args.info: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

args.name: offset
args.info: The offset of the item at which to begin the response. See offset-based paging for details.

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of items to return. The default is 100 and the maximum is 1,000.

blocks.name: getMetadataTemplate
blocks.description: Get information about a metadata template.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: scope
args.info: The scope of the object. Global and enterprise scopes are supported. The Global scope contains the properties template, while the enterprise scope pertains to custom template within the enterprise.

args.name: template
args.info: A unique identifier for the template. The identifier must be unique across the scope of the enterprise to which the metadata template is being applied. The character limit is 64 and is validated by this regex: ^[a-zA-Z_][-a-zA-Z0-9_]*$

blocks.name: createMetadataTemplate
blocks.description: Create a new metadata template with the specified schema.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: scope
args.info: The scope of the object. Only the enterprise scope is supported.

args.name: templateKey
args.info: A unique identifier for the template. The identifier must be unique across the scope of the enterprise to which the metadata template is being applied to. Defaults to a string derived from the displayName if no value is provided.

args.name: displayName
args.info: The display name of the template.

args.name: hidden
args.info: Whether this template is hidden in the UI. Defaults to false.

args.name: fieldType
args.info: The data type of the field's value. Templates support four attributes types: string, enum, float, and date (RFC 3339).

args.name: fieldKey
args.info: A unique identifier for the field. The identifier must be unique within the template to which it belongs. Defaults to a string derived from the displayName if no value is provided.

args.name: fieldDisplayName
args.info: The display name of the field

blocks.name: getEnterpriseTemplates
blocks.description: Used to retrieve all metadata templates within a user's enterprise. Only the enterprise scope is supported.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: marker
args.info: The position marker at which to begin the response. See marker-based paging for details.

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of items to return. The default is 100 and the maximum is 1,000.

args.name: keyName

args.name: keyValue
args.info: Value of key

blocks.name: getFolderSingleMetadata
blocks.description: Get the metadata instance for a folder.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: folderId
args.info: Folder id

args.name: scope

args.name: template
args.info: The key of the template. For example, the global scope has the properties template.

blocks.name: getEnterpriseUsers
blocks.description: Returns all of the users for the Enterprise. Only available to admin accounts or service accounts.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: userType
args.info: The type of user to search for. One of all, external or managed. The default is managed

args.name: filterTerm
args.info: Only return users whose name or login matches the filter_term. See notes below for details on the matching.

args.name: fields
args.info: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

args.name: offset
args.info: The offset of the item at which to begin the response. See offset-based paging for details.

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of items to return. The default is 100 and the maximum is 1,000.

blocks.name: deleteUser
blocks.description: Delete a user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: userId
args.info: The ID of the user

args.name: notify
args.info: Whether the destination user will receive email notification of the transfer

args.name: force
args.info: Whether the user should be deleted even if this user still own files

blocks.name: updateUser
blocks.description: Update the information for a user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: userId
args.info: The ID of the user

args.name: fields
args.info: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

args.name: notify
args.info: Whether the destination user will receive email notification of the transfer

args.name: enterprise
args.info: Set this to null to roll the user out of the enterprise and make them a free user

args.name: name
args.info: The name of this user

args.name: role
args.info: The user’s enterprise role. Can be coadmin or user

args.name: language
args.info: The language of the user.

args.name: isSyncEnabled
args.info: Whether the user can use Box Sync

args.name: jobTitle
args.info: The user’s job title

args.name: phone
args.info: The user’s phone number

args.name: address
args.info: The user’s address

args.name: spaceAmount
args.info: The user’s total available space amount in byte. A value of -1 grants unlimited storage.

args.name: canSeeManagedUsers
args.info: Whether the user can see other enterprise users in its contact list

args.name: status
args.info: active, inactive, cannot_delete_edit, or cannot_delete_edit_upload

args.name: collabId
args.info: Collaboration Id

args.name: fields
args.info: The email address to add to the account as an alias

blocks.name: createCollaboration
blocks.description: Create a new collaboration that grants a user or group access to a file or folder in a specific role.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: fields
args.info: The email address to add to the account as an alias

args.name: notify
args.info: Determines if the user (or all the users in the group) will receive email notifications

args.name: itemType
args.info: file or folder

args.name: itemId
args.info: The ID of the file or folder that access is granted to

args.name: accessibleByType
args.info: user or group

args.name: accessibleById
args.info: The ID of the user or group that is granted access

args.name: accessibleByLogin
args.info: The email address of the person to grant access to. Use instead of id to invite new users

args.name: role
args.info: The level of access granted. Can be editor, viewer, previewer, uploader, previewer uploader, viewer uploader, co-owner, or owner

args.name: canViewPath
args.info: Whether view path collaboration feature is enabled or not. View path collaborations allow the invitee to see the entire ancestral path to the associated folder. The user will not gain privileges in any ancestral folder (e.g. see content the user is not collaborated on).

blocks.name: updateCollaboration
blocks.description: Update a collaboration.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: collabId
args.info: Collaboration Id

args.name: fields
args.info: The email address to add to the account as an alias

args.name: role
args.info: The level of access granted. Can be editor, viewer, previewer, uploader, previewer uploader, viewer uploader, co-owner, or owner

args.name: status
args.info: The status of the collaboration invitation. Can be accepted, pending, or rejected.

args.name: canViewPath
args.info: Whether view path collaboration feature is enabled or not. View path collaborations allow the invitee to see the entire ancestral path to the associated folder. The user will not gain privileges in any ancestral folder (e.g. see content the user is not collaborated on).

blocks.name: deleteCollaboration
blocks.description: Delete a collaboration.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: collabId
args.info: Collaboration Id

blocks.name: getUserEvents
blocks.description: Get events for a given user. A chunk of event objects is returned for the user based on the parameters passed in. Parameters indicating how many chunks are left as well as the next stream_position are also returned.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: streamPosition
args.info: The location in the event stream from which you want to start receiving events. You can specify the special value now to get 0 events and the latest stream_position value. Specifying 0 will return all available events.

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of items to return. The default is 100 and the maximum is 500.

blocks.name: getEnterpriseEvents
blocks.description: Retrieves up to a year' events for all users in an enterprise. Upper and lower bounds as well as filters can be applied to the results.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: eventType
args.info: A comma-separated list of event types. Only matching events are returned.

args.name: streamPosition
args.info: The location in the event stream from which you want to start receiving events. You can specify the special value now to get 0 events and the latest stream_position value. Specifying 0 will return all available events.

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of items to return. The default is 100 and the maximum is 500.

args.info: When this task is due. Example: 2014-04-03T11:09:43-07:00

blocks.name: updateTask
blocks.description: Updates a specific task.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: taskId
args.info: Task Id

args.name: message
args.info: An optional message to include with the task

args.name: dueAt
args.info: When this task is due. Example: 2014-04-03T11:09:43-07:00

blocks.name: deleteTask
blocks.description: Permanently deletes a specific task.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: taskId
args.info: Task Id

blocks.name: getTaskAssignment
blocks.description: Fetches a specific task assignment.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: taskAssignmentId
args.info: Task Assignment Id

blocks.name: createTaskAssignment
blocks.description: Used to assign a task to a single user. There can be multiple assignments on a given task.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: taskId
args.info: Task Id

args.name: assignToId
args.info: The ID of the user this assignment is for

args.name: assignToLogin
args.info: The login email address for the user this assignment is for

blocks.name: updateTaskAssignment
blocks.description: Used to update a task assignment

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: taskAssignmentId
args.info: Task Assignment Id

args.name: message
args.info: A message from the assignee about this task

args.name: resolutionState
args.info: Can be completed, incomplete, approved, or rejected

blocks.name: deleteTaskAssignment
blocks.description: Deletes a specific task assignment.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: taskAssignmentId
args.info: Task Assignment Id

blocks.name: getTaskAssignments
blocks.description: Retrieves all of the assignments for a given task.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: taskId
args.info: Task Id

blocks.name: getSingleRetentionPolicy
blocks.description: Used to retrieve information about a retention policy.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: policyId
args.info: Policy Id

blocks.name: createRetentionPolicy
blocks.description: Used to create a new retention policy.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: policyName
args.info: Name of retention policy to be created

args.name: policyType
args.info: finite or indefinite

args.name: retentionLength
args.info: The retention_length is the amount of time, in days, to apply the retention policy to the selected content in days. Do not specify for indefinite policies. Required for finite policies.

args.name: dispositionAction
args.info: If creating a finite policy, the disposition action can be permanently_delete or remove_retention. For indefinite policies, disposition action must be remove_retention.

blocks.name: updateRetentionPolicy
blocks.description: Used to update a retention policy.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: policyId
args.info: Policy Id

args.name: policyName
args.info: Updated name of retention policy

args.name: dispositionAction
args.info: If creating a finite policy, the disposition action can be permanently_delete or remove_retention. For indefinite policies, disposition action must be remove_retention.

args.name: status
args.info: Used to retire a retention policy if status is set to retired. If not retiring a policy, do not include or set to null.

blocks.name: getRetentionPolicies
blocks.description: Retrieves all of the retention policies for the given enterprise.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: policyName
args.info: A name to filter the retention policies by. A trailing partial match search is performed.

args.name: policyType
args.info: A policy type to filter the retention policies by.

args.name: createdByUserId
args.info: A user ID to filter the retention policies by.

blocks.name: getRetentionPolicyAssignment
blocks.description: Used to retrieve information about a retention policy assignment.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: retentionPolicyAssignmentId
args.info: Retention Policy Assignment Id

blocks.name: createRetentionPolicyAssignment
blocks.description: Used to retrieve information about a retention policy assignment.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: policyId
args.info: The ID of the retention policy to assign this content to.

args.name: assignToType
args.info: Can only be one of two attributes: enterprise or folder.

args.name: assignToId
args.info: Id of the content to assign the retention policy to

blocks.name: getSingleRetentionPolicyAssignments
blocks.description: Returns a list of all retention policy assignments associated with a specified retention policy.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: policyId
args.info: The ID of the retention policy to assign this content to.

args.name: type
args.info: The type of the retention policy assignment to retrieve. Can either be folder or enterprise.

blocks.name: getSingleFileVersionRetention
blocks.description: Used to retrieve information about a file version retention

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: fileVersionRetentionId
args.info: File version retention Id

blocks.name: getFileVersionRetentions
blocks.description: Retrieves all file version retentions for the given enterprise.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: fileId
args.info: A file ID to filter the file version retentions by

args.name: fileVersionId
args.info: A file version ID to filter the file version retentions by

args.name: policyId
args.info: A policy ID to filter the file version retentions by

args.name: dispositionAction
args.info: The disposition action of the retention policy. This action can be permanently_delete, which will cause the content retained by the policy to be permanently deleted, or remove_retention, which will lift the retention policy from the content, allowing it to be deleted by users, once the retention policy time period has passed.

args.name: dispositionBefore
args.info: See content times for formatting

args.name: dispositionAfter
args.info: See content times for formatting

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of items to return. The default is 100.

args.name: marker
args.info: Base 64 encoded string that represents where the paging should being. It should be left blank to begin paging.

blocks.name: getSingleLegalHoldPolicy
blocks.description: Get information about a legal hold policy.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: policyId
args.info: Policy Id

blocks.name: createLegalHoldPolicy
blocks.description: Create a new legal hold policy.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: policyName
args.info: Name of Legal Hold Policy. Max characters 254.

args.name: description
args.info: Description of Legal Hold Policy. Max characters 500.

args.name: filterStartedAt
args.info: Date filter applies to Custodian assignments only.

args.name: filterEndedAt
args.info: Date filter applies to Custodian assignments only.

args.name: isOngoing
args.info: After initialization, Assignments under this Policy will continue applying to files based on events, indefinitely.

blocks.name: updateLegalHoldPolicy
blocks.description: Update a legal hold policy.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: policyId
args.info: Policy Id

args.name: policyName
args.info: Name of Legal Hold Policy. Max characters 254.

args.name: description
args.info: Description of Legal Hold Policy. Max characters 500.

args.name: releaseNotes
args.info: Notes around why the policy was released. Optional property with a 500 character limit.

blocks.name: deleteLegalHoldPolicy
blocks.description: Sends a request to delete an existing legal hold policy. Note that this is an asynchronous process - the policy will not be fully deleted yet when the response comes back.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: policyId
args.info: Policy Id

blocks.name: getLegalHoldPolicies
blocks.description: Get all of the legal hold policies for the enterprise.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: policyName
args.info: Case insensitive prefix-match filter on Policy name.

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of items to return. The default is 100 and the maximum is 1,000.

args.name: marker
args.info: Take from 'next_marker' column of a prior call to get the next page

blocks.name: getSinglePolicyAssignment
blocks.description: Get information about a policy assignment.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: assignmentId
args.info: Assignment Id

blocks.name: createNewPolicyAssignment
blocks.description: Create a new policy assignment, which applies the legal hold policy to the target of the assignment.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: policyId
args.info: ID of Policy to create Assignment for.

args.name: assignToId
args.info: Possible values for id are file_version_id, file_id, folder_id, or user_id

args.name: assignToType
args.info: Possible values for type are 'file_version', 'file', 'folder', or 'user'

blocks.name: deletePolicyAssignment
blocks.description: Sends a request to delete an existing policy assignment. Note that this is an asynchronous process - the policy assignment will not be fully deleted yet when the response comes back.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: assignmentId
args.info: Assignment Id

blocks.name: getPolicyAssignments
blocks.description: Get all of the assignments for a legal hold policy.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: policyId
args.info: ID of Policy to get Assignments for. Can also specify a part of a URL

args.name: assignToType
args.info: Filter assignments of this type only. Can be file_version, file, folder, or user.

args.name: assignToId
args.info: Filter assignments to this ID only. Note that this will only show assignments applied directly to this entity.

blocks.name: getFileVersionSingleLegalHold
blocks.description: Get information about a file version legal hold.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: id
args.info: ID of File Version Legal Hold

blocks.name: getFileVersionLegalHolds
blocks.description: Get all of the non-deleted legal holds for a single legal hold policy.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: policyId
args.info: ID of Legal Hold Policy to get File Version Legal Holds for

blocks.name: getWebhooks
blocks.description: Get all webhooks in an enterprise.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: marker
args.info: The position marker at which to begin the response. See marker-based paging for details.

args.name: limit
args.info: The maximum number of items to return. The default is 100 and the maximum is 200.

blocks.name: getSingleWebhook
blocks.description: Get information about a webhook.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: webhookId
args.info: Webhook Id

blocks.name: createWebhook
blocks.description: Create a new webhook.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: targetType
args.info: Target type. file or folder

args.name: targetId
args.info: Target Id

args.name: triggers
args.info: Event types that trigger notifications for the target. Example: FILE.UPLOADED,FILE.DOWNLOADED

args.name: address
args.info: The notification URL of the webhook. The notification URL is the URL used by Box to send a notification when the webhook is triggered.

blocks.name: updateWebhook
blocks.description: Update a webhook.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: webhookId
args.info: Webhook Id

args.name: targetType
args.info: Target type

args.name: targetId
args.info: Target Id

args.name: triggers
args.info: Event types that trigger notifications for the target. Example: FILE.UPLOADED,FILE.DOWNLOADED

args.name: address
args.info: The notification URL of the webhook. The notification URL is the URL used by Box to send a notification when the webhook is triggered.

blocks.name: deleteWebhook
blocks.description: Delete a webhook.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token is a data string that enables Box to verify that a request belongs to an authorized session.

args.name: webhookId
args.info: Webhook Id
